column4: can you do dpkg --get-selections and confirm that Gwibber is uninstalled?
is there a way to page this list?  cuz it's so long, it fitted only from m to z in the terminal ;)
no idea on the paging. I am lazy and use Xchat
nevermind, just adding g* at the end of your command did the job ;)
you could pipe it to less
and now I can tell you that dpkg shows "install" next to the four gwibber-service variants, so I assume it's not installed.
ok, so how do I get rid of this thing?  I'm pretty sure I even did a "purge" version of uninstall
weird, purge should nuke it all from orbit
oh wait, maybe I removed the app, but not the services (daemons or sth) ?
try "apt-get uninstall" + paste those gwibber packages
you can select each one and middle-click to paste them quickly.\
you probably already know that though. XD
every time I boot into Windows I middle-click all over the place and go "Why can't I paste anything?"
r u sure that's the right syntax?  he tells me "invalid operation uninstall".
I did apt-get remove gwibber-service*  and it killed this sucker! :)  Thanks a lot for your help.
